Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2012 05:52AM Hpios65 wrote: DiDel Thank you for the reply! First thing Tuesday morning someone is getting a phone call. I am just worried that perhaps other women are experiencing the same. Ice has been my friend. Thanks again, Hope.
Posts.Title: PAINFUL TREATMENT MRI Hpios65 Hpios65

Posts.Content: Hpios65 wrote: After having a routine MRI for surveillance, there was a suspicious lump that needed a closer look. My dr recommended a biopsy done with the MRI. The procedure itself wasn't terrible, oh ,but it wasn't good either. It was what came immediately afterward that shocked the pants off of me! I believe the woman holding pressure on my breast was squeezing as tight as she could for a total of about 5 minutes! I was crying out in pain! I felt that that much pressure was totally unnecessary and beyond cruel and unusual punishment. Has anyone else experienced this? Am I just a wimp? Should I complain to someone? Dx 2/19/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 1/19 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: PAINFUL TREATMENT MRI Hpios65 Hpios65

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 03:19AM Hpios65 wrote: Well, thanks for the response. My thought is that a woman should not have to go through that much pain, and it makes me wonder if the intense pressure(pain) would be the culprit of future damage to the breast. I did complain to the place I had it done and a risk management nuse got back to me and said that she would investigate. I'll write back and let you know the outcome.
